Issues.Title: optimistic TrackValue check, supporting not anymore connected columns
Issues.Body:
## User Story
I had an issue where I manipulated the `Columns` property of a DataGrid by removing a column. This resulted in a null-reference issue because the `TrackValue` method of the internal class `CellAutomationValueHolder` references to `column.DataGridOwner` which was not set anymore for the DataGridColumn since it was removed.

This is not a default (and maybe not wanted) behavior, but I think WPF should use here an optimistic check.

## Description
Adding a optimistic check by ignoring all `TrackValue` calls where the `DataGridOwner` property of the column is not set.


## Customer Impact

Might throw a null-reference-exception from `System.Windows.Automation.Peers.UIElementAutomationPeer.FromElement(UIElement element)` which is called within the `CellAutomationValueHolder.TrackValue` method.


## Testing

CI

## Risk

None

###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/pull/6553)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "optimistic TrackValue check, supporting not anymore connected columns" (#6553)

Issues.Title: Rely on Visual- not LogicalParent in GridSplitter
Issues.Body:
`GridSplitter` should rely on its `VisualParent` not it's `LogicalParent`

Fixes #6490

## Description
`GridSplitter` needs to interact with it's parent, this however should be the Visual and not the Logical parent.

## Customer Impact

GridSplitters do not work in `IsItemsHost` scenarios.


## Testing

I copied the modified code since I havent managed to build WPF yet.

## Risk

I dont think it is possible to use a `ControlTemplate` for a `Grid`, so `VisualParent` should generally be the more suitable solution

Issues.Title: Ignore NotImplementedException from ITaskbarList
Issues.Body:
Fixes #2377

## Description

In some cases, not closer specified in the documentation, [ITaskbarList::HrInit](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/shobjidl_core/nf-shobjidl_core-itaskbarlist-hrinit) can fail. When that happens, WPF applications setting `Window.TaskbarItemInfo` crash without possibility of gracefully handling the error.

This PR fixes the issue by checking for the result of HrInit, and not proceeding with taskbar customization if it fails, as per the documentation. "Not proceeding" simply means returning from the `ApplyTaskbarItemInfo` method the same way it is done in the method in other cases (e.g. API not supported by OS).

## Customer Impact

Application crashes when it sets `TaskbarItemInfo` and the API fails. Reports in #2377 indicate this happens in cases when no user is logged in, a custom shell without taskbar is used, or under terminal services.

## Regression

No.

## Testing

Built and verified that `TaskbarItemInfo` is still working on 7.0-preview3. Closed Explorer and verified the app crashes before the fix and does not crash after the fix, and that the taskbar info still gets applied when Explorer is restarted. Verified the error is appears in the trace output.

## Risk

I believe the risk is minimal. There is no changes to public API. There is a behavior change in an internal interface (no longer throws exceptions on error), but the fixed method is the only callsite currently using it. The handle to `ITaskbarList` is released in the `finally` block as per the documentation.

A valid worry is that throwing an exception is actually the desired outcome when taskbar is not available and application tries to use it. However, since the code already simply ignores other cases when this API is not available and developers cannot easily catch or avoid the exception, ignoring the error seems to be a consistent and justifiable behavior.




###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/pull/6547)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Ignore NotImplementedException from ITaskbarList" (#6547)

Issues.Title: Fix build when using Razor source generator
Issues.Body:
Fixes dotnet/wpf#4421

## Description
Fixes build when using Razor source generator by adding RootNamespace to the list of property added to the generated project.

Without this PR, the Razor source generator would generate files in the wrong namespace (`WpfBlazorRepro_5s0cnboz_wpftmp ` instead of `WpfBlazorRepro`).

## Customer Impact
Without this PR, customers cannot build a WPF application with the Razor source generator (Maybe others?).

## Regression
No. To my knowledge, it never worked.

## Testing
Tested by building the repro project in the issue (https://github.com/Eilon/WPFXamlRazorGeneratorBug). This PR fixed the build.

## Risk
Low.

###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/pull/6535)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Fix build when using Razor source generator" (#6535)

Issues.Title: Fix build when using source generators
Issues.Body:
Fixes dotnet/wpf#6522
Fixes https://github.com/dotnet/roslyn/issues/60257

## Description
Fixes the build when using source generators.

## Customer Impact
Without this PR, customers cannot build a WPF application with source generators.

## Regression
No. To my knowledge, it never worked.

## Testing
Tested by building a blank WPF application that uses the Regex source generator. This PR fixed the build.

## Risk
Low.

/cc @RussKie (It looks like your hunch about the `Analyzers` property was right)

###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/pull/6534)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Fix build when using source generators" (#6534)

Issues.Title: No AutomationPeers created for MenuItems when using GroupStyle
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: 6
* Windows version: 10
* Does the bug reproduce also in WPF for .NET Framework 4.8?: Did not try
* Is this bug related specifically to tooling in Visual Studio (e.g. XAML Designer, Code editing, etc...)? No

 <!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/blob/main/Documentation/issue-guide.md -->
 
 **Problem description:**
When using GroupStyle for Menu and ContextMenu, the MenuItem instances within a GroupItem are not visible in the automation tree. 
Reason: The AutomationPeer for Menu does not inherite from ItemsControlAutomationPeer. Therefore GroupItemAutomationPeer.GetChildren returns null.

 **Actual behavior:** <!-- callstack for crashes / exceptions -->
No automation peers for MenuItem instaces within GroupItem are shown in the AutomationTree. 

 **Expected behavior:**
There should be an AutomationPeer for each MenuItem 

 **Minimal repro:**
[TestAutomationPeerForMenu.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/files/8626528/TestAutomationPeerForMenu.zip)

I verified the AutomationTree using Accessibility Insights and Snoop.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "No AutomationPeers created for MenuItems when using GroupStyle" (#6530)

Issues.Title: Avoid unnecessary duplication of fields in NullableBooleanBoxes
Issues.Body:
## Description

A boxed boolean doesn't know whether it came from a nullable bool or a bool, so there's no need to maintain separate True/FalseBox objects for bool? vs bool, nor do we need to store a NullBox... that field will just be null.

## Customer Impact

Nothing measurable.  This is just unnecessary duplication.

## Regression

No

## Testing

CI

## Risk

Minimal

###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/pull/6529)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Avoid unnecessary duplication of fields in NullableBooleanBoxes" (#6529)

Issues.Title: Reuse bool box objects in UncommonField<bool>.SetValue
Issues.Body:
## Description

In some scenarios, these UncommonField<bool>s end up being set very frequently, and each time the value being passed in gets boxed.  We can avoid that by caching and reusing a box for each of the only two possible values (though it looks like the default value is almost always false and so it mainly only boxes true).

## Customer Impact

Unnecessary allocation

## Regression

No

## Testing

CI

## Risk

Minimal.

###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/pull/6528)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Reuse bool box objects in UncommonField<bool>.SetValue" (#6528)

Issues.Title: WPF Characters render differently in XPS document and on screen ( VisualContainer ) in WPF Application
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: (e.g. 3.0 Preview1, or daily build number, use `dotnet --info`) :  **Any ( 5.0 , 6.0 )**
* Windows version: (`winver`)   **Any**
* Does the bug reproduce also in WPF for .NET Framework 4.8?:   **Yes**
* Is this bug related specifically to tooling in Visual Studio (e.g. XAML Designer, Code editing, etc...)? If yes, please file the issue via the instructions [here](https://docs.microsoft.com/visualstudio/ide/how-to-report-a-problem-with-visual-studio?view=vs-2019)   **No**
* Security issues and bugs should be reported privately, learn more via our [responsible disclosure guidelines](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/blob/main/README.md#reporting-security-issues-and-security-bugs).

 <!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/blob/main/Documentation/issue-guide.md -->

Output on Screen : 
![on-screen](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/85861525/166672314-d70301ab-d03a-4eaa-b61c-0c6f3829f6bd.png)

Output in XPS File :
![on-xps](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/85861525/166672309-e2b395c6-b72f-44e5-9052-58332714b88a.png)

 
 **Problem description:**
When we render WPF characters as an XPS document, the output is incorrectly rendered as compared to that on the screen, thus affecting the visual fidelity of the applications.

 **Actual behavior:** <!-- callstack for crashes / exceptions -->
Incorrectly sized outputs when XPS document is created.
 
 **Expected behavior:**
 The output on both screen and XPS document is similar.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "WPF Characters render differently in XPS document and on screen ( VisualContainer ) in WPF Application" (#6525)

Issues.Title: [DevDiv VSO: 1425279] WPF should ignore transitory/ignorable DWM error
Issues.Body:
Fixes #5688
[DevDiv VSO: 1425279] WPF should ignore transitory/ignorable DWM error

Main PR <!-- Link to PR if any that fixed this in the main branch. -->
None
## Description
[DevDiv VSO: 1425279] WPF should ignore transitory/ignorable DWM error code (STATUS_MESSAGE_LOST) from DwmFlush

An app can opt-in to the behavior of ignoring all DwmFlush errors by setting a regkey in
HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Avalon.Graphics\IgnoreDwmFlushErrors
or
HKLM\Software\Microsoft\Avalon.Graphics\IgnoreDwmFlushErrors
whose name is the full path to the .exe that wants to opt-in, and whose DWORD value is 1.
<!-- Give a brief summary of the issue and how the pull request is fixing it. -->

## Customer Impact

<!-- What is the impact to customers of not taking this fix? -->

## Regression
No
<!-- Is this fixing a problem that was introduced in the most recent release, ie., fixing a regression? -->

## Testing
Tested on .NET framework and Core both with internal test passes.
<!-- What kind of testing has been done with the fix. -->

## Risk
None
<!-- Please assess the risk of taking this fix. Provide details backing up your assessment. -->
